forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 2am. Cloudy. Low around 39, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. South wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 50 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 51 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the twilight settles over Boston, a gentle shroud of clouds blankets the city, heralding the promise of rain in the early hours. The air feels crisp, teasing the senses with the coolness of the approaching winter. The winds stir softly, their whispers hinting at gusts to come, reminding us that nature has not yet set aside its capricious temperament. Tonight's low will embrace the chill of the season, while a late lift in temperatures suggests a shift driven by the south wind, urging the weary to wrap themselves warmly in layers, perhaps donning a favorite scarf or a thick coat.

Tomorrow beckons with the inevitability of rain, a steady companion throughout the day. The sky remains inscrutable and overcast, an ideal canvas for contemplation or a cozy afternoon indoors. While the outside world may become drenched, consider finding solace in a warm cup of tea, or lose oneself in the pages of a good book. Sweet aromas from the oven, wafting through your home, might veil the somber mood brought by the moisture-laden air. The vibrations of life in the city pulsate as the rains begin, inviting creativity in calm moments and reflecting the quiet beauty of a quintessentially New England day.
